intro: Hieracium atricomum, commonly known as the black-centred hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow with a dark center. Hieracium atricomum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and is often found in temperate climates.
